bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. POE of Texas:H.R. 6391.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 14[Page H6000]

item.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H6074)
Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

summary.text:
Terminates the Islamic Republic of Pakistan's designation as a major non-NATO ally.

Prohibits the President from issuing a separate designation of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan as a major non-NATO ally.

Directs the President to submit an annual report to Congress containing a list of each country designated as a major non-NATO ally and a justification as to why each such country should continue to be so designated.

bill.title: To terminate the designation of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan as a major non-NATO ally, and for other purposes.

item.title: To terminate the designation of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan as a major non-NATO ally, and for other purposes.
To terminate the designation of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan as a major non-NATO ally, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
